column3:
Research and postgraduate study at the GSA seeks to integrate the highest levels of practice-led, studio-based and theoretical approaches, providing opportunities for ambitious students to build on previous undergraduate or professional experience and to reflect on and develop personal practice. Through working within a highly focused community framework students develop the necessary confidence and independence to proceed into a range of careers - fashion, textiles, design, architecture - or the path of a practicing artist.

The ethos of the GSA is all about becoming a motivated and independent creative thinker and practitioner within today's international arena. The place of the research community within this vision is central. Research at the school is outward facing - in other words we encourage our undergraduates and postgraduates to connect actively with the processes and outcomes of visual research.

Please follow the link on the left to learn more about research at GSA.

column4: • The GSA has one of the largest art and design communities in the UK after the University of the Arts London

• The GSA has 8 research centres ranging across advanced 3D computer visualisation, environmental architecture, digital textiles, archives and collections, drawing, fine art practice, art in social context and pedagogy
• The GSA has research partnerships with institutions worldwide including the Central Academy of Fine Arts in Beijing and the College of Fine Arts at the University of New South Wales
• The GSA promotes and supports interdisciplinary practice across art, design, architecture and related fields
• The GSA offers a range of modes of resaerch degree submission from traditional thesis to a portfolio with written commentary
• The GSA has 5 postgraduate taught programmes attracting students worldwide and is developing a range of new programmes including a Research Masters
• Research Degrees at the GSA are supported through a one-year comprehensive training programme and team supervision throughout the project
• The GSA has a number of research clusters bring together researchers across disciplines
• The GSA has around 40 qualified research degree supervisors
• The GSA is committed to research excellent through the support of staff researchers and post-graduate research students
